entry.title: at least 14 civilian journalists killed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Russian airstrike on Kyiv TV Tower (video featured) killed Yevhenii Sakun, one of at least 14 civilian journalists killed in the line of duty during the Russo-Ukrainian War?

entry.title: John Mahn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Vorpostenboot John Mahn was the only German ship sunk during the Channel Dash?

entry.title: Jørgen Læssøe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Jørgen Læssøe became Professor Extraordinaire of Assyriology at the University of Copenhagen in 1957, he was the only active professional Assyriologist in Denmark?

entry.title: The Goldberg Variations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Goldberg Variations, performed to Bach's music, was partly choreographed by Jerome Robbins while he was in a wheelchair?

entry.title: Mary Renault (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Renault was encouraged by J. R. R. Tolkien to write a novel set in medieval times, but she burned the manuscript because she felt it lacked authenticity?

entry.title: Chatterbox (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Hainanese chicken rice at the Singaporean restaurant Chatterbox was developed by a German chef?

entry.title: The Uses of Disorder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Uses of Disorder, characterized by one reviewer as "the best available contemporary defense of anarchism", was intended to be a critique of orderly city life?

entry.title: Leonel Gómez Vides (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Leonel Gómez Vides died in 2009, one of his friends expressed surprise that he had not been murdered?
